required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparative Analysis of REVOLVE, LipoGrafter, and the Standard Decantation Technique in Autologous Fat Grafting During Breast Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparative Analysis of REVOLVE, LipoGrafter, and the Standard Decantation Technique in Autologous Fat Grafting During Breast Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to learn whether there is a superior fat processing method in terms of graft retention in breast reconstruction after mastectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in efficacy of fat grafting technique, as measured by 3D volumetric scanning at the surgical site
primary_outcome.description: 3D volumetric scanning assesses the fat graft retention defined as the ratio of fat remaining at the surgical site at 90 day follow-up to that at pre-operative baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in patient satisfaction of fat grafting technique, as measured by the BREAST-Q questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: The BREAST-Q questionnaire is used for measuring pre- and postoperative psychosocial, physical, and sexual well-being, satisfaction with breasts, experience of care, and satisfaction with outcome. Scores range on a 0-100 scale, with higher scores indicating better outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of palpable masses from the fat grafting technique, as measured by a physical exam.
secondary_outcome.description: The physical exam will provide the number of palpable masses at the surgical site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of lesions of probable fat necrosis from the fat grafting technique, as measured by a physical exam
secondary_outcome.description: The physical exam will provide the number of lesions of probable fat necrosis at the surgical site

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of infection from the fat grafting technique, as measured by a physical exam
secondary_outcome.description: The physical exam will show if there is infection present at the surgical site. This is a binary "yes/no" item.

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence seroma from the fat grafting technique, as measured by a physical exam
secondary_outcome.description: The physical exam will show if there is seroma present at the surgical site. This is a binary "yes/no" item.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of wound healing from the fat grafting technique, as measured by a physical exam
secondary_outcome.description: The physical exam will show if wound healing is normal or delayed at the surgical site. This is a binary "normal/delayed" item.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive the REVOLVE Advanced Adipose System technique during breast reconstruction.
Participants will receive the LipoGrafter technique during breast reconstruction.
Participants will receive the Standard decantation technique during breast reconstruction.

intervention.description: The REVOLVE system is an all-in-one fat processing device that harvests, filters, actively washes, and removes strands from lipoaspirate and allows for reinjection without any additional manipulation (REVOLVE 2020).
The LipoGrafter system is designed to be a start-to-finish closed system with minimal processing of the lipoaspirate, minimizing the risk of contamination and fat cell damage (LipoGrafter 2020).
Traditional standard decantation technique for breast reconstruction.

overall_official.affiliation: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

facility.name: New York Presbyterian - Weill Cornell Medicine
